ConfigItem.Desc: User Event or System Event associated with the configuration.
AT Command to send when the mapped System or User Event occurs.
User Event that will be originated when the mapped Button Sequence is asserted in the correct order.
Button Pattern. 0
Button Pattern. 1
Button Pattern. 2
Button Pattern. 3
Button Pattern. 4
Button Pattern. 5
Pio mask.
State mask.
Specifies the duration for which the selected Logical Input must be asserted in order to generate the mapped System or User Event.
button number to assign, 0 to 15
input number, 0 to 31

DefinePattern.PatternName: Module1 Example Pattern with Config Array

ConfigItem.Desc: User Event that will be originated when the mapped Button Sequence is asserted in the correct order.
Example use of a array in a pattern 0
Example use of a array in a pattern 1
Example use of a array in a pattern 2
Example use of a array in a pattern 3
Example use of a array in a pattern 4
Example use of a array in a pattern 5

When the right channel is enabled it will automatically be assigned the complimenting channel to that configured above. In the case of the subwoofer being routed to this interface this setting has no effect

Enable and select audio to route to the digital audio interfaces. Each audio type must not be routed to more than one audio interface. If routing primary AND secondary audio, they must not be split across interface types and must both be assigned to the digital audio interfaces only
number of steps of volume change permitted
volume point at which curve of dB conversion changes
volume point at which curve of dB conversion changes
number of steps of volume change permitted
Struct example field b
Struct example field c
Struct example field c
volume point at which curve of dB conversion changes
number of steps of volume change permitted
Struct example field b
number of steps of volume change permitted
volume point at which curve of dB conversion changes
Event for which prompts need to play
Specifies the index of the Auido Prompt file in the Sink file system. This field is autogenerated by the config Tool and should not be directly written by the user.
Determines in which Sink system states the Audio Prompt mapped to this User Event can be played. If the User Event occurs and the Sink is in a state masked off, the Audio Prompt will not be played.
This bit causes the Audio Prompt not to be played if SCO or Wired audio is currently routed.
Any queued Audio Prompts or Tones will be flushed when an event occurs with an Audio Prompt configured with this bit set.
Specifies the event type
Specifies the tone type
The 'Virtual Button' IDs allow you to map one or more IR or BLE inputs onto a User Event.
The application state(s) for which the event *user_event* will be valid
Which 'Virtual Button' event is required to cause the User event to trigger

The Application User Event that will be triggered when the Virtual Button event meets the required conditions (this is offset from EVENTS_USR_MESSAGE_BASE, (i.e. for EventUsrPowerOn, this value will be set to 1)

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO for Voice Mic A

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.

ConfigItem.Id: Audio Instance for Voice Mic A

ConfigItem.Desc: Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO for Voice Mic B

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.

ConfigItem.Id: Audio Instance for Voice Mic B

ConfigItem.Desc: Sets the gain of the analogue input path.
Selects the digital line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.
Selects the digital line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

This configuration item specifies the ADC Input audio bit resolution. Note: This configuration item is only relevant for analog audio input and this is only applicable to CSR8675 and CSR8676 and not on CSR8670.
This configuration item specifies the output audio bit resolution. Note this is applicable only for CSR8675 and not CSR8670 also on wired audio routing only when output is I2S, SPDIF and Analog.
Enabling this allows for the setting of volume trims on a per channel basis.

Sets the method of volume adjustment used across audio output groups. Hardware: volume scaling is applied at the DAC in the case of analogue output, or in external hardware controlled by I2c. DSP: volume scaling is applied in the digital domain by the DSP. Hybrid: A combination of DSP and hardware scaling is employed in order to maximise the S/N ratio of the audio output.
Sets a fixed gain applied to hardware in units of dB/60, only used when the volume scaling method is set to DSP
Sets the volume trim of the primary audio output (when enabled), in units of dB/60
Sets the volume trim of the secondary audio output (when enabled), in units of dB/60
Sets the volume trim of the subwoofer audio output (when enabled), in units of dB/60
Sets the volume trim of the aux audio output (when enabled), in units of dB/60

This configuration item specifies whether incoming audio comes from wired analogue, I2S or SPDIF. If USB is being used as an input audio source, this setting should be configured to 'Internal' (this is currently required because any back channel present must be relayed to the connected PC via USB, and this is currently only supported for the Analogue Input plugin - configured here as 'Internal'). Warning: when the Audio Input Routing has been changed to I2S or SPDIF, the USB back channel cannot be used.

When set, this checkbox controls whether a wired analogue input is connected through to the DSP as a Stereo stream. If it remains unchecked, wired analogue audio will be connected as a Mono source. Note: this Configuration Item is only relevant for wired analogue input routing, not I2S, S/PDIF or any other wired sources.
Enable this to force the re-sampling of tones and route playback via the DSP

ConfigItem.Id: One Mic Back Channel DSP Kap File Selection
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if the low latency DSP applications should be used when negotiating the aptX and Faststream codecs which provide additional CVC wideband back channel support.

ConfigItem.Id: Two Mic Back Channel DSP Kap File Selection
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if the low latency DSP applications should be used when negotiating the aptX and Faststream codecs which provide additional CVC wideband back channel support.
This bitmask specifies which codecs are to be supported as SPDIF inputs. If no bits are checked SPDIF input will expect PCM.

This threshold is used to configure the silence detection used in the DSP. It is a linear level expressed as a 16 bit integer, where 32767 is full scale and specifying a value of zero will disable the feature. If you wish to convert this into a value in dB units, the threshold to be set can be calculated as: 32767 * 10 ^ (dBthresh / 20) Where dBthresh is the threshold level (quoted as dBFS). 10 is a reasonable default for the threshold (it equates to -70 dBFS).
The time delay between silence being detected and the Audio Active PIO being driven, specified in seconds.
This is the volume level used after initial power up. The default volume can be set in the range 0 to 15. The sixteen levels can be configured in PSKEY_SPEAKER_GAIN_MAPPING.
Allows the volume to be adjusted while the Sink has been muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn).
If the Sink is muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn) this bit determines the action to take when an EventVolumeUp/EventVolumeDown or an AG volume indication message occurs.
1 = Inverts the operation of the volume controls, 0 = Volume control normal orientation.
This configuration item specifies which audio plug-in is used for SCO audio connections.
Selects between automatic priority based input switching (typically used in a headset) and manual source selection driven by user events.
Setting this bit will result in the Sink using the low power audio codec options to help reduce Sink power consumption.

This timer value, in minutes, causes the link encryption key to change when the timer expires, e.g. if set at 15 minutes the key used to encrypt the Bluetooth link is changed every 15 minutes, this improves the security of the Sink. Note: The encryption is only refreshed when no SCO link is open, i.e. there are no active calls. If the timer expirers when there is an active call, no action is taken and the timer is rescheduled for another timeout period.
When set the Sink will not send role switch requests to the AG. This feature may be useful if the AG does not support role switching.
When enabled the Sink is connectable while attempting to reconnect to a dropped device.

ConfigItem.Id: Enter Discoverable Mode at Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: This automatically enables the connectable/discoverable mode after a power up.
If the AutoReconnectPowerOn is enabled ActionOnPowerOn defines the AG that the Sink tries to connect to at next Power On.
If the AutoReconnectPowerOn is enabled ActionOnPowerOn defines the AG that the Sink tries to connect to at next Power On.

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Id: Different SLC Connected Event at Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the event EventSLCConnectedAfterPowerOn is generated when an SLC occurs straight after power on. The event EventSLCConnected is generated on SLC events when the Sink has already been on for some time.

The time in seconds that the Sink remains in the connectable / discoverable state (pairing mode). Setting this to 0 results in the Sink entering and immediately exiting discoverable mode, with the result that the device cannot be discovered. If the Sink is to always be discoverable while not connected, then the feature bit Automatic Pairing Mode Enable (see PSKEY_USR6) should be used in conjunction with this timeout.

ConfigItem.Id: Pairing Mode Timeout if PDL is Empty [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: Zero to disable, if set to a non zero value this is the pairing mode timeout value, in seconds, if the PDL is completely empty. If the PDL is not empty the PairModeTimeout value is used instead.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off after PDL is Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink will power off when the paired devices list is reset.
This allows the action taken on a pairing mode timeout to be defined.
ConfigItem.value: Power off if PDL is empty

enum.key: Power off if PDL is empty

ConfigItem.Id: Enter Pairing Mode on Failure to Connect
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the sink goes into pairing mode if it fails to connect with any paired devices, otherwise it goes into connectable mode.
When set Bluetooth 2.1 Man in the Middle enabled. Enabling this feature requires further customer development of the Sink application to support Man in the Middle mode.

This bit enables secure pairing mode. If set, then the Sink only accepts pin code requests when in pairing mode (connectable/discoverable state). This prevents a remote user from pairing with the Sink without the Sink being specifically placed into pairing mode. This is over-ridden if the Sink initiates the connection. i.e. if a Sink attempts to connect to a remote AG without the correct link key (or has the bdaddr but not the link key) then the Sink will accept a pin code request.

ConfigItem.Id: RSSI Pairing if PDL Less Than
ConfigItem.Desc: When set to a non-zero value and the number of devices in the paired devices list is less than this value, the Sink goes into RSSI Inquiry (Proximity Pairing) mode.

Makes the Sink connectable on a button press. This is used with multipoint operation in the situation where one Sink is already connected and the user wishes to connect a second Sink and needs to make the Sink connectable to do so.
If this item is set the Sink remains discoverable at all times. This is useful for Multipoint operation.

This forces the Sink to Enter Discoverable mode (pairing) if the paired device list is less than the entry. An entry of 2 would mean that if the Sink has previously paired with either 0 or 1 devices, then the Sink enters discoverable mode. 0 means feature disabled.

ConfigItem.Id: Do Not Go Discoverable during Link Loss
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink does not enter discoverable mode if a link loss event has occurred.

Defines the AG that the device will try to connect to when a call that has been transferred to an AG is transferred back to the Sink (using the Sink). The Call Transfer Reconnect Action is evoked when the Sink is used to transfer a call to the AG then back to the Sink. This only applies to AGs that disconnect the Sink when it transfers a call.
ConfigItem.value: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink silently reboots and reconnects to the AG in the event of a panic.
Sets the reconnection action type if the chip reboots as a result of an application or firmware panic.
ConfigItem.value: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Id: Reconnect Last Number of Attempts to Try
ConfigItem.Desc: When using the reconnection type of LAST, this parameter controls the number of times the Sink attempts to connect to the last connected devices, a minimum value of 2 is suggested for this parameter. The range of ReconnectLastAttempts is 0 to 7.

This specifies the number of reconnection attempts following an establish SLC event, or automatic reconnection event, if set to 0 and the reconnection action is set to 'Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list' the PDL will be traversed once only, if this value is set to 100 for example the PDL will be traversed for 100 connection attempts.
This is the timeout value, in seconds, for RSSI initiated pairing.
The inquiry transmit power used. See HCI_Write_Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level command in the Bluetooth Specification v2.1 + EDR.
The peak RSSI value that any discovered devices RSSI value must exceed to be considered a suitable in-range device.
Defines the difference in RSSI values returned by two devices before the stronger device is considered suitable for the auto connection feature.

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=413, MsWord=4, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=5, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: Defines the Class of device that the inquiry looks for. Class of Device Filter values are detailed in the Assigned Number document available on the Bluetooth SIG website.
Defines the peak RSSI value that any device's RSSI value must exceed to be connected to automatically, using the RSSI auto connection feature.
Defines the difference in RSSI values returned by two devices before the stronger device is considered suitable for the auto connection feature.
Specifies a limit for the number of devices found during an inquiry search, if 0 value there is no limit on the number of devices found.
Specifies the maximum inquiry time for device searching, in units of 1.28 seconds
Time to wait between inquiries, in seconds.
Specifies the number of results from a search that are stored.
When set this feature will prevent the connection to any device that is not currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature prevents the Sink from trying to pair to a device that has been previously paired to the Sink and is currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature forces the Sink to attempt to pair/connect to the entire list of devices it found during a search.

ConfigItem.Id: Start RSSI Pairing on PDL Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the Sink will start RSSI pairing automatically if the paired device list is erased.

When set Multipoint will be configured as enabled in the HFP library. If a VM Sink application requires to use Multipoint it can then be enabled by writing to the multipoint_enable bit in the CONFIG_SESSION_DATA i.e. USR key 0. This can be achieved in one of three ways. Firstly, it can be set from this Sink config Tool using the 'Enable Multipoint in VM App' control, below. Secondly, it can be set manually from the VM App source code. Or thirdly, it can be set at runtime in the VM using an event.
When set enables AVRCP control. This feature is not supported on some ROM variants.
If enabled AVRCP play status is used to speed up audio source switching.
This feature is only present in the A2DP platform. It is used to specify the period, in seconds, over which to attempt reconnection following a link loss.
When set the Sink can stream audio using an A2DP link.
This bitmask specifies which codecs are available for use. N.b. A corresponding DSP codec application must be available if these bits are enabled or the Sink will panic.

When set The Sink performs a media open when the A2DP signalling connection has been made and the A2DP stream had previously been suspended. This can happen if the Sink has suspended a stream and the phone has chosen to drop the signalling channel completely.
Sets the AV Minor Class of device
Default A2DP volume level
When set the Sink assumes that the AG is responsible for suspending the media connection when receiving an incoming call.
When set enables Phone Book Application Profile (PBAP) functionality.
When set the mute command is sent to both AGs when using multipoint.
Mute reminder value
The time in seconds after which the network service indication is replayed if there is no network present in the connected AG.

The Sink applications include a Missed Call feature. This sends an EventMissedCall event when the Sink has seen an incoming call that did not get answered before being terminated at the remote end, this event is repeatedly sent if the MissedCallIndicateTime timer value is set to a non-zero value and repeats at the interval set by this parameter. Timer is in seconds.
This parameter specifies the number of times the missed call indication will be played at the Indicator interval time.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a last number redial on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a voice dial operation on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
Supported HFP Features.
ConfigItem.value: HFP_NREC_FUNCTION | HFP_THREE_WAY_CALLING | HFP_CLI_PRESENTATION | HFP_VOICE_RECOGNITION | HFP_REMOTE_VOL_CONTROL | HFP_ENHANCED_CALL_STATUS | HFP_CODEC_NEGOTIATION | HFP_INDICATORS

ConfigItem.Desc: This bitmask specifies which HF Indicators are available for use. Note: HFP_INDICATORS feature should be enabled to select the below HF indicators.
caller_name under CSR supported_features.
raw_text under CSR supported_features.
sms under CSR supported_features.
batt_level under CSR supported_features.
pwr_source under CSR supported_features.
codecs under CSR supported_features.
codec_bandwidths under CSR supported_features.
Bandwidth to use for enhanced HFP audio.
Bandwidth to use for enhanced HFP audio.
Specifies the maximum latency.
HFP 1.5 voice settings.
This is retransmission_effort

These are bit-field values. Be aware that some of the values indicate which synchronous packet types may be used while other values indicate the reverse, e.g. which synchronous packet types may NOT be used.
ConfigItem.value: HV1 Enable | HV2 Enable | HV3 Enable | EV3 Enable | EV4 Enable | EV5 Enable | 3EV3 Enable | 3EV5 Enable

ConfigItem.Desc: This allows the Sink to send an answer (ATA) AT command if an incoming call is detected on connection.
When set the mute command is sent to both AGs when using multipoint.

ConfigItem.Id: Force Second SCO to use EV3 S1 Settings
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines the behaviour of the second SCO connection in multipoint mode. When set the second SCO connection is forced to use EV3 S1 packets for better interoperability with certain AGs.
Enables HFP Audio Parameters configuration settings.
Supported HFP Features.
The bitmask containing the supported HFP codecs. Regardless of this setting, the application will automatically select mandatory codecs of the selected HFP profile version.
When set noise reduction and echo cancelling is not advertised
When set the Sink will send extended error reports.
The time, in minutes, following a link loss occurrence that the Sink will attempt to reconnect to the dropped AG.
The time interval, in seconds, at which the headset will make reconnection attempts following a link loss.
The indicator showing service status.
The indicator showing signal strength.
The indicator showing roaming status.
The indicator showing battery charge.

ConfigItem.Id: Mute Speaker as well as Microphone
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set Mute mutes both the Speaker and the Microphone of the Sink. This only affects HFP, not other profiles, e.g. A2DP etc.

Only advertising reports that contain the selected service UUIDs will be processed in the sink application. This increases the chances of the sink application connecting to a remote device supporting the required services. Eg. If HID and IAS advertising report filters are selected, then only received advertising reports containing HID or IAS UUIDs will be handled in the sink application.
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before repeating the alert event
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before stopping the alert
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before repeating the alert event
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before stopping the alert
This bitmask specifies the notification categories to be enabled on the ANCS Server (Apple Device)

This field is used to specify maximum connection allowed in Peripheral role. If the user sets more than 2 and/or if combination of this and Maximum Number of Supported Remote Controllers is more than 2, then this value is restricted to 1
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Indicates the institution that assigned the Vendor ID.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as assigned by the Vendor ID source.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=448, MsWord=5, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=6, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=448, MsWord=7, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=8, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D
This configures a PIO to enable the device to switch into DUT mode on power on.

This configures a PIO to detect whether the aux output is connected at power on. If configured this will mute the main output and un-mute the aux output on power on. If disabled all outputs will be un-muted at power on. This should be used in conjunction with main/aux mute events to mute the main output when aux output is connected.
Configures the PIO to drive when a call is active.
Configures the PIO to drive when an incoming call is ringing.
Configures the PIO to drive when an outgoing call is ringing.
Configures the PIO to drive when audio is active
Configures the PIO to drive when the device powers up.
Configures the PIO to drive for the audio mute line used to mask state transitions of the Power on PIO.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 16 to 31, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 0 to 15, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.

Mapping assignments for PIO 16 to 31. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

Mapping assignments for PIO 0 to 15. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. PIO 0 to PIO 12 are automatically mapped for general input/output access, it is not necessary to set the map pins for PIO 0 to PIO 12. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation.

Audio routing mode for a Master TWS device relaying audio in a TWS session. Warning: Changing this audio routing mode will have no effect on a TWS device that has already been paired, as the routing is stored persistently in the paired device attributes. This routing choice is only stored on initial TWS pairing.

Audio routing mode for a Slave TWS device receiving audio in a TWS session. Warning: Changing this audio routing mode will have no effect on a TWS device that has already been paired, as the routing is stored persistently in the paired device attributes. This routing choice is only stored on initial TWS pairing.

ConfigPatternArray.Id: Look Up Table Array Input Manager

ConfigItem.Desc: Timer that is armed immediately after the first input is pressed, once this timer fires, no further multiple buttons will be included in the pattern [ms]
After a short duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when short timer fires [ms]
After a long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
After a very long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
After a very very long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
Every repeatTimer duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events on short timer firing, such as repeated volume events [ms]
The time in seconds after which the Sink switches off. If set to 0 then the Sink remains on indefinitely

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off After Power On Time [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds after Power On for which the Power Off event has no effect. This is used for example, if the UI specifies that a long press on Power On enters pairing mode but a long press at any other time (including in the connectable state) should Power Off the Sink.
Specifies the amount of time in seconds the Sink remains connectable following a successful connection when using multipoint operational modes before not being connectable any more.

This value determines the delay time, in ms, between the connection of AG1 and the start of connection to AG2 when using multipoint mode of operation. This value may be changed from its default value if interoperability issues are seen with certain AGs.

ConfigItem.Id: Power PIO Delay on Power Down [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: Delay in seconds before signalling the change of state on the Power state output pin after system power down.
The value in seconds that the Sink waits in the limbo state for a power on event before powering off. The limbo state is entered when the device is powered or receives a power off event.

ConfigItem.Id: Store Current Sink Volume and Audio Source Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed after the last Volume Up/Down or Audio Source button was pressed, to store settings into PS Store.
The delay in milliseconds between the Power state output pin indicating system power up and the Audio Mute pin being released.
The delay in milliseconds between the Audio Mute pin being driven and the Power state output pin indicating power down.

ConfigItem.Id: GAIA User Defined EQ Settings Persistent Store Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed after the last GAIA command has been received to store EQ settings into PS Store.
When no audio is routed the application will periodically check if a PS Defrag is required. Time in seconds, if set to zero the feature is disabled.

This configuration item is used in conjunction with 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' to force a PS Defrag to occur. The PS Defrag operation is checked at Power Off or optionally on a timer and will start automatically when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Key Size' is less than 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys'.

ConfigItem.Id: PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys
ConfigItem.Desc: Forces a PS defrag when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Trigger - Key Size' is less than the 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' value.

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off after Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink ignores the power off button press immediately after power on.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off only if Vreg Enable Low
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this feature prevents the Sink from powering off if the VREG enable pin is not low.

ConfigItem.Id: Reset Chip after Power Off is Complete
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink will perform a chip reset after powering off. This may be used if the BlueCore IC is powered permanently with no other form of hardware reset available.

ConfigItem.Id: Auto Power On after Initialisation Enable
ConfigItem.Desc: This feature allows a faster Sink startup period by removing the need for a power on event to be configured on a button press.

When set, this feature prevents the Sink device from physically powering off after the device is made logically off, for example, after a user initiated power off event. The device will still physically power off if the battery level reaches a critical level or temperature is outside of operating limits.
User defined Variable Tones initilization value
If this item is set Tones are played at a nominal fixed volume regardless of the current Profile Volume level.
When set the Sink plays a tone when the volume is changed using the remote device i.e. the AG.
This allows volume tones to be queued in the Sink.
This allows event tones to be queued in the Sink.
When set the mute reminder tone is played at a fixed volume, set by the default volume level parameter 'Default Volume'.

This sets the volume level at which tones are played if the fixed level has been enabled. Fixed tone volume is enabled by setting PlayTonesAtFixedVolume to 1. FixedToneVolumeLevel can be set in the range 0 to 31.

IMPORTANT: the number of languages supported by the Audio Prompt engine if included in the build. To use Audio Prompts in the Sink device, the 'Number of Languages Supported by Audio Prompts' must be set to at least 1.
If set this feature will allow any audio prompt configured to indicate an incoming call to play to completion, even if the call is answered immediately or the call terminates.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable Phone Number Readout by Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When set Audio prompts are used to 'speak' an incoming caller number.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out PIN Code using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When set PIN/Passkey/Confirmation messages are read out using preconfigured Audio Prompts.

ConfigItem.Id: Time Before Confirming Audio Prompt Language [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: When changing audio prompt languages, it is possible to have the language change automatically confirmed and stored. If set to a non-zero value the change will be committed to ps after the configured time in seconds.
The time interval, in ms, in which a second press may be detected leading to a double press event instead of reporting the button press as a single press.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a long timer message.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very long timer message.
The time, in ms, between repeat messages being generated if a button is held down.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very very long timer message.
The number of debounce checks performed.
The interval between each debounce check in ms.

ConfigItem.Id: Ignore Button Event if Enabling LEDs
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this prevents a button from raising an event, but only when LEDs are being re-activated. It merely re-enables the display of LEDs (when they had previously timed out) but the associated event with the button press will not occur.
GAIA session enabled on connection.
GAIA connection remains after power off.
This specifies the SQIF partition to use for GAIA Over-the-Air Device Firmware Upgrade.

ConfigGroup.Id: Advanced Settings that were an Expert Node

ConfigItem.Desc: Max remote latency for slc link
Min remote latency for slc link
Min Local Timeout for slc link
Max remote latency for sco link
Min remote latency for sco link
Min Local Timeout for sco
Audio enhancements

ConfigItem.Id: Group A Struct A Item e
ConfigItem.Desc: DUT MICS
page scan interval
page scan window
inquiry scan interval
inquiry scan windowl

When set Multipoint will be configured as enabled in the HFP library. If a VM Sink application requires to use Multipoint it can then be enabled by writing to the multipoint_enable bit in the CONFIG_SESSION_DATA i.e. USR key 0. This can be achieved in one of three ways. Firstly, it can be set from this Sink config Tool using the 'Enable Multipoint in VM App' control, below. Secondly, it can be set manually from the VM App source code. Or thirdly, it can be set at runtime in the VM using an event.

ConfigGroup.Id: Event to AT Command Mapping Table

ConfigItem.Desc: This lists AT Commands.
If this configuration item is programmed with a phone number, this will be sent to the Audio Gateway when a one-touch dial call event occurs on the device.
